Event.name: Clemency
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Executive_authority</fen> exercises their power to reduce or remove negative consequences for someone who has been labeled an <fen>Offender</fen> who participated in an <fen>Crime</fen>.
<ex><fex name="off">A Fort Worth man convicted of a robbery his brother later confessed to committing</fex> was <m>granted</m> <t>clemency</t> <fex name="zei">on December 20, 2002</fex>, <fex name="exe">by Governor Rick Perry</fex>.</ex> <ex>A Fort Worth man convicted <fex name="cri">of a robbery his brother later confessed to committing</fex> was <m>granted</m> <t>clemency</t> on December 20, 2002, by Governor Rick Perry.</ex>
<ex>Engel represented Robert Bacon, <fex name="off">the first man</fex> <fex name="exe">Easley</fex> <m>gave</m> <t>clemency</t> <fex name="zei">in 2001</fex>. <fex name="cri">INI</fex> </ex>
<ex>Ohioans will receive a blow-by-blow account of arguments before the Ohio Parole Board on whether <fex name="off">Cincinnatian John Byrd Jr.</fex> should be executed or <m>granted</m> <t>clemency</t> <fex name="cri">for a 1983 murder</fex>. <fex name="exe">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Offender
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual who is accused or convicted of a <fen>Crime</fen>.
<ex>Since 1976, <fex name="off">225 death row inmates</fex> have been <m>granted</m> <t>clemency</t> for humanitarian reasons. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Crime
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action deemed criminal by law.
<ex>I never saw a legal case where a person was given <t>clemency</t> <fex name="cri">for murder</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Executive_authority
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to grant clemency.
<ex>Mr. Papa was <m>granted</m> <t>clemency</t> for a drug conviction <fex name="exe">by Mr. Pataki</fex>, and released in 1997</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> is responding to in granting clemency.
<ex>Since 1976, 224 death row inmates have been granted <t>clemency</t> <fex name="exp">for humanitarian reasons</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which clemency is granted.
<ex>In addition to Ms. White, 55, Mr. Pataki granted <t>clemency</t> <fex name="zei">yesterday</fex> to three men serving long prison terms for offenses under the stern Rockefeller-era drug laws that mandate long sentences for some relatively low-level drug crimes.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> that accomplishes the granting of clemency.
<ex>Write, call, e-mail, or fax Governor Frank O'Bannon as soon as possible and urge him to grant <t>clemency</t> <fex name="mea">by giving Gary Burris a sentence of life without parole</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the act of clemency which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>) and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Executive_authority</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> intends to accomplish by granting clemency.
<ex>And so he <m>granted</m> <t>clemency</t> <fex name="pur">so that all who surrendered would be received as freedmen into his own army</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> grants clemency.
<ex>Apparently, no woman has ever been <m>granted</m> <t>clemency</t> <fex name="pla">there</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: clemency.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an act wherein an executive authority reduces a sentence or pardons an offender
